channel.title: Cyclone Analogic TT-606 Controller & FX
channel.description: The [Cyclone Analogic TT-606](https://www.cyclone-analogic.fr/en/85-drum-drone-tt-606-8606164010378.html) has some cool additional features which require some button-combination presses to reach though. Fortunately they can also be controlled via MIDI, so I made this Axoloti controller, using my trusty [Akai Midimix](https://www.akaipro.com/midimix): So we have mute buttons at our fingertips, control over tone and even instrument sound selection, shuffle, auto fill rate (I love this feature!) and individual "nuance" controls for almost all instruments. This lets us keep the TT-606 in sequencer mode, for pattern switching, chaining and editing, while the sound parameters are controlled with the Midimix. I also included a crunchy distortion audio effect combo (just has a wet/dry know and a bitcrush amount knob) and two buttons for temporary low cut and/or hi cut. You can download everything, including the Midimix mapping file, from my Axoloti GitHub: https://github.com/TuesdayNightMachines/Axoloti/tree/master/TT-606_Controller **Make sure to set your TT-606 to input MIDI channel 11** ... or change the channel in the Axoloti project (look for the comment). Enjoy :slight_smile:

item.title: Cyclone Analogic TT-606 Controller & FX
item.dc:creator: @NightMachines The Tuesday Night Machines
item.description:
@NightMachines wrote:

The Cyclone Analogic TT-606 has some cool additional features which require some button-combination presses to reach though. Fortunately they can also be controlled via MIDI, so I made this Axoloti controller, using my trusty Akai Midimix:

TTNM__TT-606_Control_v01_Description.jpeg1528x2124 1.71 MB

So we have mute buttons at our fingertips, control over tone and even instrument sound selection, shuffle, auto fill rate (I love this feature!) and individual "nuance" controls for almost all instruments. This lets us keep the TT-606 in sequencer mode, for pattern switching, chaining and editing, while the sound parameters are controlled with the Midimix.

I also included a crunchy distortion audio effect combo (just has a wet/dry know and a bitcrush amount knob) and two buttons for temporary low cut and/or hi cut.

You can download everything, including the Midimix mapping file, from my Axoloti GitHub:

github.com

TuesdayNightMachines/Axoloti

Sharing some of my Axoloti DSP Projects. Contribute to TuesdayNightMachines/Axoloti development by creating an account on GitHub.

Make sure to set your TT-606 to input MIDI channel 11 ... or change the channel in the Axoloti project (look for the comment).

Enjoy
